title: I know who barfed on Ms Jingleplunker's shoe.
body: <p>I was reading <a href="http://chicago.metblogs.com/archives/2006/07/rep_rahm_emanue.phtml">a post</a> earlier where the author was criticized for their incorrect usage of <em>whom</em>. One of the comments linked to a great explanation of <a href="http://www.wonderfulwritingskillsunhandbook.com/html/who_vs_whom.html">when to use who vs. whom</a>. Aside from the quirky examples, what's nice is that they show the correct usage of both within the first 2 sentences:</p><blockquote><p>"If I spoke perfect English, to whom would I speak it?"</p><p>I forget who said that, but I really like the sense of it.</p></blockquote>
bodyArticleHtml:
2006-07-17

I know who barfed on Ms Jingleplunker's shoe.

I was reading
If I spoke perfect English, to whom would I speak it?
